alert.note: Alert for Crisp; Dooly; Houston; Macon; Marion; Schley; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 9:18PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Macon, southeastern Marion, western Dooly, southeastern Webster, southwestern Houston, Schley, Sumter and northwestern Crisp Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 918 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Bartlett to near Bronwood, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, pea sized hail, frequent lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Ellaville, Oglethorpe, Preston, Montezuma, Plains, Byromville, Ideal, Leslie, Andersonville, Lilly, De Soto, Dooling, Desoto, Cobb, Sumter, Lamar, Whitewater State Park, Croxton Crossroads and New Era. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Crisp; Dooly; Houston; Macon; Marion; Schley; Sumter; Webster
